text: so let's look at exactly what MPs are
going to be voting on right now
it's the withdrawal agreement the
divorce deal the agreement that covers
the practicalities of how the UK will
leave the European Union it contains
details of the thirty nine billion pound
payment to the EU the highly
controversial Irish backstop to keep the
border open whatever happens and the
guarantee of citizens rights the
political declaration the other part of
the deal which sets out the future
relationship with the European Union is
not now being looked at today so what
happens if the agreement is approved
well first of all it means that the UK's
date to leave the European Union is set
to the 22nd of May for the political
declaration on future relations with the
European Union will still need to be
agreed and MPs may find that impossible
to do so even if the Prime Minister wins
today's vote there is a chance Britain
could still exit the EU without a deal
and if the agreement doesn't get enough
support in the Commons and is rejected
well what happens then first the UK's
date to leave the EU reverts to being
the 12th of April that's exactly two
weeks today
therefore it's likely that the
government will go back to the EU and
ask for another extension of article 50
which means brexit would be delayed even
further possibly until the end of the
year or beyond and then locked will
Teresa may step down to break the
deadlock could there be another
referendum or even a general election
nobody knows
